title: Understanding Error Checking Rules
text: When working with spreadsheets, it's important to identify and correct errors in formulas and data entries. This ensures the accuracy and reliability of your data analysis.

title: Common Formula Errors
text: Some common errors include formulas that result in an error, such as #DIV/0! or #VALUE!. These indicate that the formula cannot be calculated as intended.

title: Inconsistent Formulas
text: Inconsistent formulas occur when a formula in a cell does not match the pattern of formulas in adjacent cells. This can lead to unexpected results.

title: Data Formatting Issues
text: Data formatting issues, such as numbers formatted as text or years represented as two digits, can cause errors in calculations and data analysis.

title: Omitted Cells in Formulas
text: Formulas that omit cells in a region can lead to incomplete calculations. Ensure that all relevant cells are included in your formulas.

title: Unlocked Cells with Formulas
text: Unlocked cells containing formulas can be accidentally modified, leading to errors. It's important to lock cells with critical formulas to prevent unintended changes.

title: Formulas Referring to Empty Cells
text: Formulas that refer to empty cells may not produce the expected results. Check your formulas to ensure they reference the correct cells.

title: Invalid Data in Tables
text: Data entered in a table that does not meet the expected criteria can cause errors. Ensure that all data entries are valid and conform to the table's requirements.
